page.title: 02NEWNHAM MILL
page.content: THE MILL WAS BUILT IN 1700 AND HAS AN UNDERSHOT WHEEL. DR.AND MRS LEAR HAVE OWNED THE HOUSE AND MILL SINCE 1972. IT TOOK TWO AND A HALF YEARS TO RESTORE AND HAD BEEN OUT OF USE FOR 30 YEARS. THE FIRST FLOUR WAS GROUND IN 1978. IT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC AT WEEKENDS FROM MAY TO AUGUST. THEY SELL LEAFLETS, POSTCARDS, BROCHURES AND FLOUR. THEY BUY THE CORN FROM A CORN MERCHANT AT LEOMINSTER. IT IS LOCALLY GROWN BREAD MAKING WHEAT. THEY MILL A THIRD OF A TON OF FLOUR A WEEK. IT IS STONE GROUND WHOLEMEAL FLOUR. THEY SELL 1 KG BAGS FOR 60P AND ALSO 16KG AND 32KG BAGS. A MILLWRIGHT FROM STONE IN STAFFS COMES TO CHISEL OUT THE GROOVES IN THE GRINDSTONE EVERY TWO OR THREE YEARS. IN THE MILLSTREAM ARE PIKE,EEL, SALMON AND TROUT.THERE ARE ALSO MINK.
